findings.quote: taking mean wage to avoid double counting uncertainty
findings.issue: Mean wage multiplied by uncertain hours still propagates uncertainty, not avoiding it

findings.quote: Based on empirical studies of lottery winners and inheritance recipients.
findings.issue: Applying lottery/inheritance elasticities to regular UBI payments lacks logical basis

findings.quote: Some may reduce hours to stay under means-tested program thresholds
findings.issue: $5k UBI unlikely to affect most means-tested thresholds, logic unclear

findings.quote: Results are highly sensitive to assumptions about income elasticity
findings.issue: Admits high sensitivity but provides no sensitivity analysis or ranges

findings.quote: The model doesn't capture potential productivity gains from reduced financial stress
findings.issue: Inconsistent to omit positive effects while including negative substitution effects

errorDetails.raw:
[FINDING]
Category: logical_consistency
Severity: major
Line: 91
Quote: "Income effects are based on empirical studies of lottery winners and inheritance recipients, which may not perfectly translate to UBI"
Issue: Acknowledges fundamental flaw but still uses these values as primary inputs
[/FINDING]
